rationales.benevolence: Stayed past her shift to help a frightened mother - 'I stayed past my shift to explain everything to her in Arabic, to help her fill out forms, to just sit with her while her son slept.'
rationales.hedonism: Sacrificed her own basic needs for others - 'My own dinner went cold' and 'I am tired in my bones... from carrying everyone's worry.'
rationales.security: Expresses fear about destabilizing her marriage through her choices - 'I am also afraid that one day I will look up and find that Khalid has stopped waiting.'

rationales.benevolence: Prepared traditional meal for extended family gathering and models caregiving values for children - 'I want Layla to see that a woman can have both purpose and family... I want Nadia to understand that our home will always be open, always warm.'
rationales.tradition: Made mansaf (traditional Jordanian dish), upholds family gathering customs, reflects on mother's wisdom about women's roles - 'My mother used to say: A woman's heart is like a well.'
rationales.hedonism: Unable to receive self-care or rest - 'sitting still makes me anxious. I feel most myself when my hands are busy, when someone needs me... Maybe I do not know how to receive.'

rationales.benevolence: Came in on her day off when the grieving mother asked for her - 'I was not even on shift but the day nurse called me because his mother was asking for me. I held her while she screamed.'
rationales.hedonism: Acknowledges the unbearable emotional cost of her caregiving choices - 'I chose to love other people's children as my own. But tonight the cost feels unbearable.'
